alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe; Surry; Watauga; Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 1:31PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT ALLEGHANY...NORTHWESTERN SURRY...WILKES...SOUTHEASTERN WATAUGA...ASHE COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN NORTH CAROLINA AND SOUTHERN GRAYSON COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 130 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wilbar, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... North Wilkesboro... Wilkesboro... Sparta... Jefferson... West Jefferson... Independence... and Lansing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
